person.persName: John Dabney Morris (Christian County, Ky, farmer, colonel (CSA))

body.p: Christian County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Hanover County, Virginia native. Son of Richard Morris and Mary Watts Morris. Married to Margaret L. Meriwether Morris. Father of Fanny M. Morris, Mary L. Morris, and Richard Morris. Attended the University of Virginia. Attorney in San Antonio, Texas, in 1837. Served in the Mexican-American War. Farmer in Christian County, Kentucky, from 1844 to 1860. Owned sixty-nine enslaved people in Christian County in 1850. Owned eighty-eight enslaved people in Christian County in 1860. Appointed by Confederate government to sequester deposits of Kentucky banks in 1861. Served in the First Kentucky Cavalry (C.S.A.) as a private in 1862. Volunteer aide-de-camp to Confederate General John S. Williams from 1862 to 1863. Appointed colonel of Provisional Army (Kentucky) of the Confederate States on September 13, 1864. Captured by U.S. Army in Kentucky in 1865 when recruiting. Exchanged as prisoner of war in 1865.
